lines.speaker: *joey
lines.text: Okay, so we went to the beach, because Phoebe found out about this lady who knew her mom and dad, and I dont really know what happened with that.

lines.text: I-I mean I, well I think I can figure it out. I guess y'know I was born, and everyone started lying their asses off!

lines.speaker: phoebe sr.
lines.text: Noo! No! It wasnt like that I... Remember how I told you how Lily, Frank, and I we were, we were close. Well, we were, we were very close.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: How close?

lines.speaker: phoebe sr.
lines.text: Well, the-the three of us we were, kind of umm, a couple.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: I dont even know how that would work!

lines.speaker: phoebe sr.
lines.text: Well, we were...

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Im not asking!

lines.speaker: phoebe sr.
lines.text: Well, any how, some how I got pregnant, and, and I was scared. I was stupid and sellfish, and I was 18 years old. I mean, you remember what its like to be eighteen years old?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Yeah. Lets see, my had Mom killed herself, and my Dad had run off, and I was living in a Gremlin with a guy named Cindy who talked to his hand.

lines.text: Well, Im so sorry. I thought I was leaving you with the best parents in the world, I didnt even hear about your Mom and Dad til a couple of years ago, and by then you were already grown up. I dont know, youre here, and I would, I would really, I would like to get to know you.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Yeah, well, everybody does! Im a really cool person. And y'know you had 29 years to find that out, but you didnt even try! Y'know what, you walked out on me, and Im just, Im gonna do the same thing to you.

lines.text: Wait!

lines.speaker: phoebe

lines.text: Nope! Because Im not your boyfriend.  Hey Pheebs, how did it go?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Okay.  Wow, its-its 5:30 in the morning.  So, Id better get cracking on this baby.

lines.text: Does it?

lines.text: Oh, sure! Im sure.

lines.text: Ennnh.

lines.text: Well, Im ready to get the hell out of here!  Oh. Are you? Are you?!!  Ohh! Thats so great!! Ooh, not for Bonnie.  But for you, yay! Ohh.

lines.text: ...fuchsia and mauvvve. Those are the 66 colours of my bedroommmm.  Thank you, thank you. Ohh, and I invite you to count the colours in your bedroom.  Except for you. You go away.

lines.text: No.

lines.speaker: monica

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: You want it?

lines.speaker: phoebe and rachel
lines.text: Oh no.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Ahh, Gepeto, $5,000 dollars? Are you insane?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Hey, the ad alone cost 300 bucks!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: All right look, Im changing it to 50 bucks, or your best offer.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: What kind of profit is that?! And you call yourself an accountant.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Nooo.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Oh. What do you do?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: I cant believe you dont know what I do for a living!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Yeah, I actually dont know...

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Good, so do I

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Something to do with numbers?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oh my God! No! Shoo! Kitty! No! No-no-no! Shoo! Come on, you!  Come on. Crazy.  Oh my God.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Nothing. Nothing.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: What? Whats wrong?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: I just, I just have this really strong feeling that this cat is my Mother.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: You mean the mom you met in Montauk. She was a cat?!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: No, no-no, she was a human lady. This is the spirit of my Mom Lily, the one who killed herself.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Are you sure shes in the cat, or have you been taking your grandmas glycoma medicine again?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: No Dr. Skeptismo! Im sure. First of all, okay, theres the feeling.  Okay, and for another, how about the fact that she went into my guitar case which is lined with orange felt.  My Mothers favourite fish is Orange Roughy...  Cats....like....fish!   Hi, Mommy.  Oh, I havent seen this smile in 17 years!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Dude, Phoebes mom has got a huge peni...

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Let it go!!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Hey!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Umm, when were you gonna tell me that youre going out with Chip Matthews?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Now? Is it okay if I go out with Chip Matthews?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Nooo! Its not okay! I cant believe you would want to after what he did to me!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: What, that little thing at the prom?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Monica! I couldnt find him for two hours! He was having sex with Amy Welch!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Come on, that was back in high school! How could that still bother you?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: I mean why, of all people would you want to go out with Chip?!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Look, you and I went to different high schools...

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Okay, that doesnt help me, because we went to the same high school.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: You went to one where you were popular, and you got to ride off Chips motorcycle, and wear his letterman jacket. I went to one where I wore a band uniform they had to have specially made.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: They had to have that specially made?!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: It was a project for one of the Home Ec classes.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh my God, they told us that was for the mascot!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Back then, I thought that I would never, ever get the chance to go out with a Chip Matthews, and now hes-hes called me up and asked me out. And the fat girl inside of me really wants to go. I-I owe her this. I never let her eat.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh, you go out with him.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Oh, really?!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Yeah. Just, if its possible, could you leave him somewhere and go have sex with another guy?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Ill try.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: So you guys having any luck getting rid of the entertainment center?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Well, there were a couple of calls last night, but ah, I dont think any of them are gonna work out.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Yes, Joey has a very careful screening process. Apparently, not everyone is qualified to own wood and nails.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Stop it! Stop it! She keeps squirming, trying to get away! Just like when she was alive.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: So Pheebs, how long is your mom gonna be with us?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Well, Im not sure. I mean, I guess until she y'know, gets used to the fact that theres y'know, a new mom. Y'know, I think shes worried that y'know, shes gonna, shes gonna be replaced.  Well, thats not gonna happen is it? Noo.  Okay, I have to return a call in the other room.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Why cant you use the phone in here?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Well, Im returning a call from a certain mom at the B-E-A-C-H. I just spelled the wrong word.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: So, guys, am I crazy, or does Phoebes mom remind anyone of a cat?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Ross, dont start.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Come on, you-you cant tell me you actually believe that-that theres a woman inside that cat!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: I believe it.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: No you dont.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Yes, I do.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: No you doy'know what, youre not gonna suck me into this.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh sure I am, because you always have to be right.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: I do not always have to beokay, okay.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Jurassic Park could happen.

lines.speaker: tony
lines.text: Wow! Thats ah, thats pretty nice!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Pretty nice?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Youll have to pardon my roommate, he wanted to marry this.

lines.speaker: tony
lines.text: We dont have 50 bucks, but would you be willing to trade for it? Weve got a canoe.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Y'know, I, I really dont think we need a canoe.

lines.speaker: tony
lines.text: You gotta take the canoe!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: All right, just, just take the entertainment center, and then when you get home, throw the canoe away!

lines.speaker: peter
lines.text: Were not throwing it away! I built that canoe!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Good for you!!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: You guys, youre never gonna believe what I just found tacked up on a telephone pole!  Look kinda familiar?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Apparently Phoebes mother also goes by the name Julio.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: You guys, theres a little girl in Soho looking for this cat. I mean, you know what that means?!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Yeah-eah! 200 dollar reward, split five ways!!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Do we have to tell her?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Yes, we have to tell her!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Oh, but its made her so happy.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Little girl misses her cat.  Crazy lady thinks her mother is in a cat.  Okay, y'know what, I have to go have dinner with my son, can I trust that when you see Phoebe, you will tell her.

lines.speaker: all
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: I hate when Ross is right!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: He is right, isnt he?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Y'know what, I think this might be one of the times hes wrong.

lines.speaker: all
lines.text: You think?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Oh-no, hes right.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Hi.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Hi!

lines.speaker: all
lines.text: Hey!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Uh, Pheebs, about your mom...

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Yeah?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Hows that going?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: So great. Oh, we took a nap today and my Mom fell asleep on my tummy and purred.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Thats so sweet.  Im gonna get some coffee.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Huh? Whatd ya say Joe? Ill be right there.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Pheebs...

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: I just feel so, uhh.....

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: All right!!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Im coming already!!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Jeez!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Not yet! Not yet! Not yet! Not yet! Not yet! Not yet! Not yet! Not yet!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Hello, Chip.

lines.speaker: chip
lines.text: Hey, Rach! How ya doin?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Im great! Im great. Ive got a great job at Bloomingdales, have wonderful friends, and eventhough Im not seeing anyone right now, Ive never felt better about myself.

lines.speaker: chip
lines.text: So ah, Monica ready yet?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Shell be out in a second. So, Chip, hows umm, Amy Welch?

lines.speaker: chip
lines.text: Amy Welch? Wow! I havent seen her since... So, Monica about ready?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: This is the unit for you my friend. Sturdy construction, tons of storage compartments, some big enough to fit a grown man.

lines.speaker: guy
lines.text: What?!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Oh yeah! I got in there myself once. My roommate bet me five bucks that I couldnt, and then he stuck a board through the handles that locked me in. Yeah. It was funny til I started feeling like I was in a coffin.

lines.speaker: guy
lines.text: No, you, you cant fit in that thing. Thats not deep enough.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Oh yeah?  If I cant, Ill knock five bucks off the price off the unit.

lines.speaker: guy
lines.text: All right, you have yourself a deal.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Okay.  See?! I told ya!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Sometimes I get in here just to get away from it! Hey, a nickel!!

lines.speaker: chip
lines.text: Here, we are.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Oh my God! You still have the Chipper!

lines.speaker: chip
lines.text: The what?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Thats what we used to call your ah, your motorcycle in high school. Y'know how a motorcycle is a Chopper, and youre Chip. Nevermind.

lines.speaker: chip
lines.text: No, I think its cute.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Wow! A lipper from Chipper.

lines.speaker: chip
lines.text: So you still in touch with anyone from high school?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Umm. Well, theres Rachel, and umm, I think thats it. How bout you?

lines.speaker: chip
lines.text: Oh yeah, I still hang with Simmons and Zana, y'know. I see Spindler a lot. Devane, Kelly, and I run into Goldie from time to time. Steve Brown, Zuchoff, McGwire, J.T., Breadsly.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Is that all?

lines.speaker: chip
lines.text: Ehh, y'know after high school, you just kinda lose touch. Oh yeah! I ran into Richard Dorfman.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Ohh, how is he?

lines.speaker: chip
lines.text: Not so good, Simmons and I gave him a wedgie.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Isnt he an architect now?

lines.speaker: chip
lines.text: Yeah, they still wear underwear.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: OH MY GOD!!!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: WHAT?!!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Are you all right?!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Yeah...

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: What happened?!!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Awww, man! He promised he wouldnt take the chairs!!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: What the hell happened?!! How were you locked in?!! And where the hell is all of our stuff?!!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Well, this guy came by to look at the unit and-and he said he didnt think big enough to fit a grown man!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: SoYou got in voluntarily?!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: I was tryin to make a sale!! Oh, man, if I ever run into that guy again, do you know what Im gonna do?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: BEND OVER?!!!

lines.speaker: chip
lines.text: ...and then Zana, just let one rip!!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Look, not that I enjoy talking about people who I went to high school with, cause I do, but umm, maybe we could talk about something else? Like you, I dont even know where you work?

lines.speaker: chip
lines.text: You know where I work!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: I do?

lines.speaker: chip
lines.text: The movie theatre, you used to come in all the time.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: You still work at the multiplex?

lines.speaker: chip
lines.text: Oh, like Id give up that job! Free popcorn and candy, anytime I want. I can get you free posters for your room.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Thanks, Im set. Do you still live with your parents?

lines.speaker: chip
lines.text: Oh yeah, but I can stay out as late as I want.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Wow! They really got you guys. Your T.V. The chairs.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oh yeah, your microwave. The stereo.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Aww, man, he took the five of spades!! Oh, no-no-no, here it is!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Oh my God! What happened?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Oh, umm, Joey was born, and then 28 years later, I was robbed!!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: So, how was your date?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Well, y'know how I always wanted to go out with Chip Matthews in high school?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Um-hmm.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Well, tonight, I actually went out with Chip Matthews in high school.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh honey, Im sorry.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: No, its okay, not only did I get to go out with Chip Matthews, I got to dump Chip Matthews.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Ohh! Thats so great!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: I know!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Hey! So ah, what did the insurance company say?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Oh, they said uh, You dont have insurance here, so stop calling us.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: You didnt tell her?!  Okay, fine! Pheebs?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Yeah?  Hi!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Hi! Listen uhh, this cat belongs to a little girl. There are flyers all over the place.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Im sorry, sweetie.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Hey, we can take her back with you if you want.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Ohh. Um-hmm. But y'know, she choose to find me. I mean, I have to respect her decision. Right?

lines.speaker: chandler, monica, joey, and rachel
lines.text: Thats a good call. Right.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: No! No! LookHey, enough is enough! Look, I am sorry that you feel guilty or whatever about spending time with your new mom, but this is not your old mom. This is a cat! Okay, Julio the cat! Not mom! Cat!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Ross, how many parents have you lost?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: None.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Okay, then you dont know what it feels like when one of them comes back. Do you? I believe this is my Mother. Even if Im wrong, who cares? Just be a friend. Okay? Be supportive.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Im sorry.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Okay.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: I dont know what to say.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: You could.... say youre sorry to her mom.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: I think she would like that.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Come here, here, come here, come here,  Mrs. Buffay. Sorry, about what I said, umm, it was, it was insensitive of me to say that you were just a cat. When clearly you are also the reincarnated spirit, of my friends mother.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Thank you. We both forgive you.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: So honey, what are you gonna do about the little girl?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Yeah, okay, listen, umm, Mom, I hope you know you still mean a lot to me. And youre welcome to come back anytime.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Pheebs, if she could come back as a couch, wed really appreciate it.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Come on, Mom, Ill take you home.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Ill go with you.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Me too.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Oh! Y'know, Ive got an extra futon.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Dude, you dont have to brag! We got nothing here!!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Hey!! We are so in luck! Treeger said that we could have all this cool stuff from the basement. Wait right there.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Oh no-no-no, Im, Im paddling away!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Huh?!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Wow! Really?! We get all this rusty crap for free?!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Uh-huh. This and a bunch of bubble wrap. And, some of it is not even popped!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Could we be more white trash?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: How desperate am I?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh! Good thing Chandlers not here, he always wins at this game.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: I just told my Mom Id cater a party for her.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: How come?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Because I need the money, and I thought that itd be a great way to get rid of that last little schmidgen of self-respect.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Come on, I think this is a good thing. I dont think Mom wouldve hired you if she didnt think you were good at what you do.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: You dont have to stick up for her. She cant here you.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Hey! Umm, do you guys have any juice?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Just pickle.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Hey uh, Rach, funny story. I ah, bumped into Joanna on the street yesterday.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: My boss, Joanna? Wow, that mustve been awkward.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Well, no, actually she uh, asked me if I wanted to get a drink.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: You ah, you didnt say Yes to that did you?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: No. No!

lines.speaker: joanna
lines.text: Hello, Rachel.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Well, not at first.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: What is she doing here?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: I dont understand! Last time you went out with her you said she was a big, dull dud.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Well, I think I judged her too quickly, and this time we were able to take the relationship to the next level.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Well, last time I almost got fired. You must end it, you must end it now!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Oh, come on! Its not like this is an everyday occurrence for me! I mean usually Im pretty much just in there by myself.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Chandler!!  Promise me, you will end it.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Okay, I promise, Ill end it.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: I hope you know what Im giving up for ya, because shes not just the boss in your office, if you know what I mean.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Yeah-eh-eah!  Oh-oh, sorry, I-I knew what he meant.

lines.speaker: mrs. geller
lines.text: Hows the hired help?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Doing great, the quiches are coming along.

lines.speaker: mrs. geller
lines.text: Whats this? Blue nail polish?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Yeah, I thought it was cute.

lines.speaker: mrs. geller
lines.text: Ahh, thats what your Grandmothers hands looked like when we found her.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Let me ask you a question.

lines.speaker: mrs. geller
lines.text: Hmm.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Why did you hire me?

lines.speaker: mrs. geller
lines.text: Oh, well Richard raved about the food at his party, of course you were sleeping with him. Then I heard the food at that lesbian wedding was very nice, I assume you werent sleeping with anybody there. Though, at least that would be something.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Oh my God! Did you hear that? She hired me because she thinks Im good.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Okay, I didnt hear that.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Oh yeah, she didnt hire me out of pity, it wasnt so she could pick on me in front of her friends, she actually thinks Im good.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Wow! And hey, its cool if youre a lesbian!

lines.speaker: the salesman
lines.text: Good afternoon, are you the decision maker of the house?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Uhhhh.

lines.speaker: the salesman
lines.text: Do you ah, currently own a set of encyclopedias?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: No! No. But ah, try the classifieds, people sell everything in there.

lines.speaker: the salesman
lines.text: Actually, Im not buying. Im selling. Let me ask you one question. Do your friends ever have a conversation and you just nod along even though youre not really sure what theyre talking about?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Im telling you its totally unconstituional.

lines.speaker: monica, chandler, phoebe, and rachel
lines.text: Oh yeah, I totally agree.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: I think he deserves a Nobel Prize.

lines.speaker: all
lines.text: Nooo!!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: it was like the Algonquin kids table.

lines.speaker: the salesman
lines.text: Excuse me, Im sorry, you havent said anything for about two and a half minutes, are you at all interested?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Yeah-well-yeah! Yeah-oh-yeah. Come on in.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Thats weird.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Your nails.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Oh, I know, I never wear fake ones. I just did it so my Mom wouldnt give me grief about me biting them.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oh, no, I meant that its weird that you only have nine now.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Oh my God. Wait a minute, I had them put  Oh my God! Its in the quiche! Oh My God!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Okay, dont panic. Im gonna go to the store, Im gonna get you another set of nails, no ones gonna know, and youre gonna look great.  Oh! Oh, its cause theyre gonna eatthats the problem.

lines.speaker: mrs. geller
lines.text: Honey, dont bite your nails.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Okay ah, please dont freak out. Umm, but ah, theres a blue fingernail in one of the quiche cups, and theres no way to know which one.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: And! Whoever finds it wins the prize!

lines.speaker: mrs. geller
lines.text: Im not freaking out.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Then why are you laughing?

lines.speaker: mrs. geller
lines.text: Its nothing, its just that now your Father owes me five dollars.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: What? You bet Id lose a nail?

lines.speaker: mrs. geller
lines.text: Oh no, dont be silly. I just bet Id need these.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Frozen lasagnas?

lines.speaker: mrs. geller
lines.text: Um-hmm.

lines.speaker: monica

lines.text: No! No! No! I just kissed her.

lines.text: What?!! Thats even worse!!

lines.text: How is that worse?!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: I dont know! But its the same!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Look, Im sorry! But theres nothing I can do, I think Im in love with her!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Who cares?! You went behind my back! I would never do that to you!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Youre right, I have no excuses! I was totally over the line.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Over the line?! You-youre-youre so far past the line, that you-you cant even see the line! The line is a dot to you!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Yes. Yes! Right! And I feel horrible. You have to believe me!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Is that why you bought all this stuff?!  Well, yknow what I will not watch your TV, I will not listen to your stereo, and theres a cinnamon raisin loaf in the new bread maker that Im not gonna eat! You know why?!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Probably because

lines.text: Phoebe, his music could not get any worse. There are rats in the basement that are hanging themselves.

lines.text: After that? Yeah! No, I mean if I can help.

lines.speaker: ross

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Yeahno, just that last song.

lines.text: Hello.

lines.text: Hey, its me. I know you cant stand to be in the same room as me, so I just thought Id try and apologize over the phone. All I

lines.text: Speaking of Christmas, umm since Monica and I are starting a new business and have like no money, umm, this year maybe we could do secret Santa, and then we each only buy one gift. And-and theres the added mystery of who gets who.

lines.text: Well, Im gonna take a nap, turkey makes me sleepy.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: I know, but all that work youre doing to get it ready, I just

lines.text: Oh thats not true! Thats not true! I got her that backpack and she loved it! I remember how much she was crying the day when that big dog ran off with it  Oh, there was no big dog. All right this sucks! I already got her this briefcase, and I had R.G. put on it  Her initials

lines.text: All right! Okay! I think I am making some progress with Joey, when I went into the apartment he went straight into his bedroom but he only slammed the door once!  I mean yeah, he gave me the finger while doing it.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: All right I I gotta call my mom and ask her a left handed cooking question.

lines.text: So listen ah, I picked Monica for secret Santa, but Im already getting her something for Chanukah, I was wondering if you wanna switch.

lines.text: Hey! Dont do the crime if you cant do the time.

lines.text: Joey, the guys your best friend.

lines.text: No, was my best friend. Anyway, I dont know why youre pushing for him so hard. With him out of the way as my best friend, theres a spot open.

lines.text: Hes fine!

lines.text: Hey, y'know, Mon, if things wrong out between you and Richards son, youd be able to tell your kids, that you slept with their grandfather.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Fine! Judge all you want to but,  married a lesbian,  left a man at the altar,  fell in love with a gay ice dancer,  threw a girls wooden leg in a fire,  livin in a box!!

lines.text: So now, what exactly is the point of the box?

lines.text: Chandler?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: The meaning of the box is three fold. One , it gives me the time to think about what I did. Two , it proves how much I care about my friendship with Joey. And three , it hurts!

lines.text: Oh hey! Hey uh, you remember the necklace I gave you last year? Can I see it?

lines.text: Ill get it! Ill get it! Ill get it! Ill get it! Ill get it! Ill get it! Ill get it! Ill get it! Ill get it! Ill get it! Ill get it! Ill get it! Ill get it! Ill get it!  Hi, Tim.

lines.text: Hey!

lines.text: My brother, Ross.

lines.text: Hey.

lines.text: And Rachel.  And thats Chandler.

lines.text: How do ya do.

lines.speaker: tim
lines.text: Whats

lines.text: Umm, well, hes

lines.text: What happened? What happened?!

lines.text: You kissed my girlfriend!

lines.text: Ooh, I like those sunglasses.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Like em, like em? Or, Id like to get store credit for that amount like em?

lines.text: All right, look! If this is just a big joke to you, then forget about it, all right?! This means something to me! And if it doesnt mean anything to you, then you should get out of there, otherwise youre just an idiot in a box!

lines.text: Youre right, and Im sorry! This means a lot to me! I want you to be my friend again! I swear, I wont say another word tonight.

lines.speaker: joey

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: That sounds like another word to me! Are you gonna take this seriously?  Okay.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Dont say that I have no sentiment!  This is a movie stub from our first date! This is an eggshell from the first time you made me breakfast in bed!  This is from the museum from the first time we were together. Okay, maybe I exchange gifts sometimes, but I keep the things that matter!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: I dont know what to say, Im sorry. Though, youre not supposed to take these.  Its like a million years old, we, we actually, we had people looking for that.

lines.text: Were 29, were not women.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Ohh, here you are. Yknow, Im-Im glad you decided to hear me out.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Okay, Im hearing.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Ive been doing a lot of thinking. A lot! And umm, well, I came up with a whole bunch of businesses you can do with your van. Okay umm, you could be flower delivery person.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: What?!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Or! A bakery delivery person.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: I wa-I wa-I wa

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Pizza?!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Monica!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: All right, Ive got a whole bunch of uh-uh, stuff in this area, but umm, Im getting the feeling that you dont want to deliver.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: No.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Okay. Im guessing that if you dont want to deliver, you probably dont want to pick stuff up either.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: No.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Yknow what, lets do the catering business.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Really?! Are you sure?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Yeah, y'know I-I made a commitment to you. Yknow what, itd be, itd be fun.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oh! It will be fun! Ohh! Yay! Oh! Okay, ooh, lets plan the wedding reception.  Wow! You really wanted me to do something with this van.  Yknow what, I want you to take the chef job.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Really?!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Yeah. Thats what you really want. Yeah, I dont want to be the reason youre unhappy, that would just make me unhappy, and I really dont want to be the reason Im unhappy.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Besides, it might be kinda fun to form the new A-Team.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh, hi Mrs. Lynch! Is Joanna in already?

lines.speaker: mrs. lynch
lines.text: Oh my goodness! You havent heard!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Heard what?

lines.speaker: mrs. lynch
lines.text: Joanna passed away last night.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh my God! How?!

lines.speaker: mrs. lynch
lines.text: Well, she was leaving work and she was hit by a cab.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh my God! Oh, I cannot believe it!

lines.speaker: mrs. lynch
lines.text: I know!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh, God. Oh, God.  Oh God.

lines.speaker: mrs. lynch
lines.text: I didnt realize that she was so close.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Yes, so close. Mrs. Lynch, I know that this is an emotional and difficult time, for all of us. But by any chance did Joanna send any paperwork your way before it happened.

lines.speaker: mrs. lynch
lines.text: No. Nothing. Imagine, if she had just stepped off that curb a few seconds later.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Yes-yes, just a few seconds and shed still be with usnothing about an assistant buyer?

lines.speaker: mrs. lynch
lines.text: No, Im sorry. I have to go.

lines.speaker: sophie
lines.text: Good morning!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh, Sophie, I guess you didnt hear about Joanna

lines.speaker: sophie
lines.text: I sure did!

lines.speaker: allesandro
lines.text: Im so excited about having Monica come on board with us. Although I do feel bad about having fired chef Emillio, its like losing a member of the family. Of course, that literally is the case for several of you. Tony, Carlos, Marie, please, tell your father how much were gonna miss him. Now, I know that Monica has a lot of great ideas for this place, well, you all read the review. So without much further ado, I present to you our new head chef.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Umm, I just wanna say, uh  that with a pinch of exictement, a dash of hard work, a dollup of cooperation, we can have the recipe...  Are you gonna kill me?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Hey!

lines.speaker: chandler, joey, and phoebe
lines.text: Hey!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Im sorry Im late, did I miss anything?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Joey stuffing 15 Oreos in his mouth.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: 15?  Your personal best!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Where were you?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Oh, on a date. Yeah, I met this girl on the train going to a museum upstate.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Oh, yeah! How did you meet her?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oh, which museum?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: No, answer his.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Okay, it was just me and her at the back of the train, and I sat near the door, so shed have to pass by me if she wanted to switch cars. She was totally at my mercy.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Were you so late because you were burring this woman?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: No, Im getting back down cause she lives in Poughkeepsie. She seems really great, but shes like totally great, but she lives two and a half hours away.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: How can she be great if shes from Poughkeepsie?  That joke wouldve killed in Albany.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Done! I did it! Heh, whos stupid now?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Hey, look at this!  Theyre lighting the big Christmas tree tonight.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Umm, that papers two weeks old.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: All right, who keeps leaving old newspapers in the trash?! I really wanted to take Kathy to this, I cant believe I missed it.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Hey, yknow, at least you have somebody to miss that stuff with! I hate being alone this time of year! Next thing you know itll be Valentines Day, then my birthday, then bang!before you know it, theyre lighting that damn tree again. Ohh, I want somebody!  Yknow, I want a man!!  I mean, it doesnt even have to be a big relationship, yknow, just like a fling would be great.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Really?! I didnt think girls ever just wanted a fling.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Well, believe me, its been a long time since Ive been flung.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Well, I know what Im giving you for Christmas.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Yknow what? Theres some nice guys at my office, do you want me to set you up?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Yeah! Wait a minute, its been a long time that Ive been single. How come you never offered this before?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Well, I have a girlfriend, Im-Im happy. So, I no longer feel the need to go out of my way to stop others from being happy.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Okay! No accountants. Oh, and no one from like legal. I dont like guys with boring jobs.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Oh and Ross was like what? A lion tamer?

lines.speaker: all
lines.text: Hey!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Whats wrong Mon?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Ohh, everybody at the restaurant still hates me.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oh.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: I thought I was making headway, everyone was smiling at me all day, I get off work and I find out that they wrote this  on my chefs hat.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Hey, maybe they meant to write, Quiet, bitch.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Hey, honey! Whats the matter?  Fine, I was just trying to be nice! Whoa!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: I mean I have not been picked on this much since kindergarten and they had to bring in someone from junior high to do the see-saw with me.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Ohhh!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: I mean theyre trying to do everything they can to make me quit, and if there were any other job, I would. But this is something Ive been waiting for my whole life.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Well, wait a minute, youre the boss! Why dont you just yell at them? Or, fire them?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: I would love too, but I cant! I mean I just cant, you know that Im not good at confrontation.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Hey, you know what you can do? I remember reading about this director, I think it was Orson Wells, who at the beginning of the movie would hire somebody, just so he could fire them in front of everybody. Then they would all know, whos boss.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Hey, Mon! Im not doing anything, why dont you fire me?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Thats a good idea! Wait, do you know how to waiter?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Good enough to get fired.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: All right, youre hired!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Hey! That must be why I got fired last week! Does this Orson Wells guy direct Burger King commercials?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Yes.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: I say, Drew! Are you seeing anybody right now?  Og-ee-op, Im not asking for me, Im I mean No, Im-Im not gay, Im not asking you out. Im not-Im not-Im not gay!

lines.speaker: drew
lines.text: I didnt think you were gay. I do now.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: See my friend-my friend, Rachel, she wants to be set up.

lines.speaker: drew
lines.text: Ahh, I just got out of a big relationship, Im not looking for any thing serious.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Oh, yknow what, that might be okay even if it was just kind of a fling, that might be all right with Rachel.

lines.speaker: mike
lines.text: Whoa-whoa-whoa-whoa! Is this, hot Rachel, that you took to the Christmas party, Rachel?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Oh, by the way, that is her full name.

lines.speaker: mike
lines.text: Oh wow! Im free for her!

lines.speaker: drew
lines.text: Oh, wait a second! I didnt say I wasnt free!

lines.speaker: mike
lines.text: Hey, Chandler, why dont we talk this over at the Ranger game tomorrow?

lines.speaker: drew
lines.text: Hold on, yknow I just got a box of Cubans, maybe I bring them by your office around uh, five?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Oh well, thats uh, a little later than I uh, generally care to stay, but sure!

lines.speaker: mike
lines.text: Maybe, before the game we could enjoy some eight year old some small batch Basel Hadens.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Well, I dont really know what that is, but lets!!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Hey! You guys, Im writing a holiday song for everyone. Do you want to hear it?

lines.speaker: monica, rachel, and joey
lines.text: Yes!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Happy Chanukah, Monica! May your Christmas be snowy, Joey! Happy New Year, Chandler and Ross. Spin the draddle, Rachel!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Pheebs, thats great!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oh, yay!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: But yknow umm, Rachel doesnt rhyme with draddle.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: I know but its so hard! Nothing rhymes with your stupid name!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: What are you talking about? Lots of things rhyme with Rachel. Bagel. Mail. Jail. Bail. Able. May-pole.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: All good, thanks.  Do you maybe have a nickname have like a nickname thats easier to rhyme?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Didnt your dad used to call you Pumpkin?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh yeah!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Pumpkin? Yeah. But did he ever call you like, Budolph?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Hello, children!

lines.speaker: all
lines.text: Hey!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Have I got the 50 guys for you!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Really?!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Oh yeah, I just showed this a picture of you and guys were throwing themselves at me! Theyre buying me drinks! Theyre giving me stuff!  Knicks tonight?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Sure! Where are the seats?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Wherever! Ive got like 20!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: So, will I like any of these guys?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Yknow what, Im gonna uh, play the field just a little more.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Chandler!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Guys are signing over their 401-Ks to me?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: You work with robots!!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Yes.  Okay, theres this one guy, Patrick, I think youre gonna like him, hes really nice, hes funny, hes a swimmer.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Ohh, I like swimmers bodies!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Yes, and his father invented that magnetic strip on the back of credit cards.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Op, I like credit cards!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: See, Im not bad at this fixing up thing, huh?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Well, so what does he do?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Oh, he works in the Fine Foods division.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Your company has a fine foods division?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Its a big company, I dontif youI

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Now, wait a second! You make food and robots?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: No! No, the robots just work for them.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: All right, Im gonna go to work. Does anybody have a problem with that?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Yeah, lady, I do! I got a problem with that!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: You want a problem? Ill give you a problem!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Oh, what are you gonna do? Youre gonna fire me?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: You bet your ass, Im gonna fire you! Thank you.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Oh, wow! I should get going. I-I got a date tonight.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Oh yeah! With who?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: You know that girl I told you about who lives up in Poughkeepsie?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Not her. Yeah, this is someone else I meet, and I-I cant decide between the two of them. Yknow the one from Poughkeepsie, even though shes a two hour train ride away, is really pretty, really smart, and-and a lot of fun. But this other girl, well, she lives right uptown. Yknow shes, well shes-shes just as pretty, I guess shes smart, shes not fun.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: If shes no fun, why do you want to date her at all?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Well, I-I want to give her another chance, yknow? She lives so close. And, at the end of the date, the other time, she-she said something that wasif she was kidding was very funny. On the other hand, if she wasnt kidding, shes not fun, shes stupid, and kind of a racist.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Hey!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Hey!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Hey, man!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Hey! Ooh, how was your first day working at the restaurant?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Damn!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Hey.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Hey.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Hey, what happened to your fancy chefs jacket?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: They baked it. I cant take this anymore. Im gonna call a meeting tonight, Im gonna fire you tonight.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: You got it! Oh-oh!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: What are you doing?!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Its still a tiny bit on fire there.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Thanks.  I think you got it!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Chandler!! You have the best taste in men!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Well, like father, like son.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Patrick and I had such a great time last night! I mean I think this could maybe turn into something serious.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Really?! I-I thought you werent looking for something serious? I thought you were looking for some kind of a fling.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Well, y'know, possibly.  You didnt tell him that, though? Right?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Ummmmmmmm, no.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: You told this guy that I was looking for a fling?! You dont tell the guy that!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Why not?! Id be thrilled if I heard that some hot girl was just looking to getoh I see.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh, between you telling him that I wanted to have a fling and me putting out on the first dateoh, hes so gonna get the wrong idea.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Hey, Joey, could you pass the cheese?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Yeah. Listen uh, Id prefer it if you didnt call me Joey. Since I dont know anyone here, I thought itd be cool to try out a cool work nickname.

lines.speaker: a waiter
lines.text: Hey, dragon! Heres your tips from Monday and Tuesday.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Theres like-theres like 300 bucks in this one!

lines.speaker: the waiter
lines.text: Yeah, people get pretty generous around the holidays. And it never hurts to wear tight trousers.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Okay. Could the waiters gather around to hear tonights specials? Okay, first there is a Chilean Sea Bass prepared with a Mango relish on a bagWhy is nobody writing these down?

lines.speaker: the waiter
lines.text: Because we can remember them.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Because your all gonna make up fake specials and make me cook them like you did the other night?

lines.speaker: the waiter
lines.text: Well, sure, that too.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Okay, forget the specials for a minute. Umm, all right heres the thing, for the last two weeks I have umm,  tried really hard to create a positive atmosphere

lines.speaker: the waiter
lines.text: Cant hear you!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: A positive atmosphere! But I-I-I have had it up to here.  From now on, it is gonna be my way, or the highway! All right? Does anybody have a problem with that?!!  Hey new guy! I said, does anybody have a problem with that?!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: No maam.

lines.speaker: the waiter
lines.text: Hey! He has a name, its Dragon. Do you wanna know your name? Check your hat.  We did the hat right?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: What the hell happened?!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: I am so-so-so sorry. I was gonna do it! Really! But I was standing there with 327 dollars in one hand and 238 dollars in the other hand, and I was thinking, "Wow! Its been a long time since I had  327 + 238 dollars!"

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Joey, we had a deal. That-thats why youre here! Ive got to fire you!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: And I gotta pay rent! Look, how-how about this? You dont fire me, instead I stay here, I gain their trust, and theyll start listening to all the nice things Ive been saying about you.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: What kinda things have you been saying?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Well nothing yet, they really hate you and I want to fit in.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Happy, happy Chanukah, Chandler and Monica. Very merry

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Oh, yknow, yknow what Pheebs?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Im not Jewish, so

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: So! Ross doesnt really decorate his tree with floss, but you dont hear him complaining do you? God!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Bad dream?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: I wasnt sleeping.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Oh yeah, then uh, what was Phoebes song about?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: The one with the cat. I gotta go, Ive got another date.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: So, did you pick one yet?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: No, it turns out that the one from uptown was making a joke. But it was a different joke than I thoughtit wasnt that funny. So Im still torn.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Well look, you dont really like the one from uptown and youre too exhausted from dating the one up in Poughkeepsie, so I say you just end them both. Okay? You take a train up to Poughkeepsie and break up with her, and on your way back you break up with uptown. And then by the time you get home tonight, youre done!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Yknow, youre right. Thank you.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Umm, well I had a similar problem when I lived in Prague.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Prague?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Theres sooo much you dont know.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Chandler! Patrick just uh, ended things with me. Did you or did you not tell him that I was looking for a serious relationship?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: I did! I absolutely did!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: You idiot!!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Im sure youre right, but why?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: You dont tell a guy that youre looking for a serious relationship! You dont tell the guy that! Now you scared him away!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Oh, man. Im sorry, Im so-so sorry.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Yknow, you should never be allowed to talk to people!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: I know! I know!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh! See just Im right back where I started! Aww, this sucks! Being alone, sucks!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Well, yknow, youre-youre gonna meet somebody! Youre a great catch! Yknow when I was telling all those guys about you, I didnt have to lie once.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Really?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Yeah! You graduated Magma Ku Laude, right?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: No.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Oh, it doesnt matter.  Hey, yknow what, Ive got two tickets to tonights Rangers game, you wanna come with me?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Cute guys in little shorts? Sure.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Well, actually its a hockey team, so its angry Canadians with no teeth.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Well that sounds fun too.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Have you ever been with a woman?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: What?! Chandler, what is the matter with you?!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: So there is no good time to ask that question.

lines.speaker: the conductor
lines.text: The next station is Poughkeepsie. Poughkeepsie!

lines.speaker: the woman from poughkeepsie
lines.text: Ross? Ross!  Wake up! Ross!  Ross! Ross!! Ross!!! Ross!!!!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: I need more swordfish.  Can you get me some more swordfish?

lines.speaker: kitchen worker
lines.text: I dont speak English.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: You did a minute ago!

lines.speaker: kitchen worker
lines.text: Well, I dont know what to tell ya!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Fine!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Okay! Very funny! Somebody let me out please?! Come on, Im cold!  And covered in marinara sauce! Come on! Let me out!

lines.speaker: the waiter
lines.text: You found that handle, did ya?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Thats not funny.

lines.speaker: the waiter
lines.text: Well thats not true.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Im a good person. And Im a good chef, and I dont deserve to have marinara sauce all over me! Yknow what, if you want me to quit this bad, then all you have to do is

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Hey! Chef Geller! Yknow that little speech you made the other day? Well I got a problem with it!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: You do?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: You bet I do! I just ah, wasnt listening then, thats all.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Well if you want a problem? Ill give you a problem!

lines.speaker: joey

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Yeah, and-and thank you for Emily.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh, no problem. Im so glad I could help. Happy for you.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Happy for you.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: No, happy for you!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: All right ladies, heres what were gonna do.  You are gonna take off my clothes.  You two, go get the oils.  And you just constantly scream at the top of your voice, "Chandlers the king! Chandlers the king!"

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: I-I wanna be with her,  I like her.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Oh, thats fine! Go with your instincts, go with your instincts.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Wait, now, what am I doing again?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Come on! Would you please pay attention, I could wake up at any moment!

lines.speaker: the cigarette guy
lines.text: Hi, Im Joshua, Im here to pick up Rachel.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: No-no-no, that not Joshua.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: What do you want from me, Ive never met the guy. So anyway, Rachel, Im sorry you cant stay,  but the rest of us have a lot of work to do.  What are you doing?  All right, listen, Ive got to wake up!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Y'know, I can't believe I'm getting my nails done!  And you said it was gonna be fun!  Which it kinda is.  Also, you said there would be other guys here. There are no other guys here!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Chandler, theres a guy right over there.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Thats a mailman! Thats our mailman!   Hi. How are ya?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Chandler, dont worry! This doesnt make you any less of a guy!  That does!  What am I sitting on?  I hate to think what this woman was scratching when this broke off.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Hey, you know who used to have nails like that?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Hmm.

lines.speaker: woman
lines.text: OH MY GAWD!!

lines.text: Joey let me ask you a question. What does this light switch do?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Ohh, Nothing.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Didnt it drive you crazy to have a switch and not know what it did?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: I know what it did! Nothing.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: They wouldnt have put it there if it didnt do something! How can you not care?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Like this.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Well, heres another question for ya. Uhh, do you know what that silver knob on the toilet does?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Sure! It flushes it.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Okay, good. Now that since you know, when you come over would you mind actually using it?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Hello!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Hey!  Ah!!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Guess who we ran into today?!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Janice?!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Isnt this amazing?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: How have you been?

lines.speaker: janice
lines.text: Oh well, Im divorced.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Ohhh, wow.

lines.speaker: janice
lines.text: Yeah, Im riding the alimony pony.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: And there it is.

lines.speaker: janice
lines.text: I just came up to say, "Hi!" Hi!  And you, sweetie, Ill see you tonight.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Okay. Bye.

lines.speaker: janice
lines.text: Bye.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Bye.

lines.speaker: janice
lines.text: Bye.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Bye.

lines.speaker: janice
lines.text: Bye.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: B-bye!

lines.speaker: janice
lines.text: Bye-bye.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Bye.   I cant stand the woman!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: What?! I thought you were crazy about her!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Yeah, I know, but all of those little annoying things she did before we fell in love? Like her voice, her laugh, her personalityWell, theyre all back! Yknow? And shes picked up like nine new ones!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: So what are you doing bringing her here?! Theres people here!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Dont worry about it. Im taking care of it tonight.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: You are not. You have never been able to break up with her.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Well, I dont have to break up with her this time. Were not involved! Im going to do a pre-emptive strike! Im going to end it with her before it starts. My ass is like frozen!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Yeah, try sticking it in the freezer for 20 minutes.  Im tellin ya!

lines.speaker: emily
lines.text: I cant believe you really walk alone here! I mean, you hear such stories about New York.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: No, its really not that bad. I mean, I-I for one, feel perfectly safe.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Help! Help!! Help! Help!!

lines.speaker: emily
lines.text: No, no, no Ross! Ross, these are friends of mine from home.  Liam, Devon, this is Ross.

lines.speaker: devon
lines.text: Hey, mate.

lines.speaker: liam
lines.text: How are ya man?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Oh hey, that was a good one, huh?  Help! Help!

lines.speaker: emily
lines.text: So how are you? Ive been meaning to ring you ever since I arrived but umm, well, Ive been rather busy.

lines.speaker: devon
lines.text: Do you realise that we have not seen each other since the night of that U2 concert?

lines.speaker: emily
lines.text: Oh my God. I think youre right.

lines.speaker: liam
lines.text: Well, actually the last time you and I saw each other was that morning.

lines.speaker: emily
lines.text: Oh, Liam.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Oh, Liam. So uh, what, were you guys playing soccer or somethingor should I call it  football?

lines.speaker: devon
lines.text: We were playing rugby.

lines.speaker: liam
lines.text: In fact were playing a game at the park tomorrow. Youre welcome to play too if you want.

lines.speaker: emily
lines.text: Ross play rugby? I dont think so.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Whats ah, whats so funny about that?

lines.speaker: emily
lines.text: Well I mean, youre American to start with. You dont even have rugby here.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Well, we didnt have freedom here until 1776, either so

lines.speaker: devon
lines.text: So good then! Well see you at Riverside Park at 2:00! Cheers!

lines.speaker: liam
lines.text: Cheers!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Cheers!

lines.speaker: janice
lines.text: Oh boy, I just love to sing!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Yes, I-I know that you do, but I think one of the reasons people were complaining though, was that they paid to hear the actor sing Old Man River.

lines.speaker: janice
lines.text: Oh, look at us! Who wouldve thought that Cupid had a station at 14th Street Nails.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Okay, we have to talk. Im just getting out of a very serious relationship

lines.speaker: janice
lines.text: I know! And Im just getting out of a marriage, I mean talk about meant to be!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Right! I just think that this is happening too soon.

lines.speaker: janice
lines.text: Oh, too soon, too schmoon. Face it honey, I am not letting you get away this time.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: I hear ya.  But! Unfortunately, my company is transferring me overseas!

lines.speaker: janice
lines.text: Oh no! Where to?  Too Paris?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: No! No! Not, Paris.

lines.speaker: janice
lines.text: Too London? No-no, Rome? Vienna? Ooh-ooh, Barcelona?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Okay, could you just stop talking for a second?  Yemen. Thats right, yes, Im being transferred to Yemen!

lines.speaker: janice
lines.text: When?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: I dont know exactly.

lines.speaker: janice
lines.text: Ugh, well I will just have to soak up every once of Chandler Bing until that moment comes.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: But I do know that its some time tomorrow.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Done?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Yep!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Hey!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Hey! Whats up?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: This switch thing has been driving me crazy. So I turned it off and checked every outlet. Now, four of them dont work. Which means, one of them has to be controlled by the switch. So, I plugged in things in all four of the outlets that-that make noise, so that way, when I turn it on I just follow the noise and find out which one it is.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: I bet I stopped listening before you did.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Yknow, you-you also couldve used uh, lamps and then followed the light.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Yeah, well, Im using noise. Okay. All right! So, is everybody ready? Here we go.  I hear something! I hear something! Where is it?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Its coming from Joey!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oh my God, thats so freaky! Turn him off!!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Ooh, hey, could we put on the news? I think it might be raining.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Oh, just hold on a second. Im watching this rugby thing on ESPN. I dont know what the big deal is. Im man enough to play this sport.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Dude, youre not even man enough to order the channel that carries the sport.

lines.speaker: janice
lines.text: Hey there Ross!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Hey!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Janice.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Yknow uh, you didnt really have to help me pack.

lines.speaker: janice
lines.text: Ohh, well when you said all you were going to be doing between now and the time you leave is packing, you didnt really leave me much choice. Did you?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Well, I-I thought I did but, I-I guess I did not!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Hey-hey, whats going on?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Oh, Im packing. Yknow Im-Im packing cause Im moving to Yemen tomorrow.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Thanks for telling me!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Im only going to pretend Im moving to Yemen, its the only way I can get rid off her.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Ohhhh, good one! And Yemen that actually sounds like a real country.

lines.speaker: janice
lines.text: Chandler! Come on, Im gonna show how to roll up your underwear and stuff it in your shoes. Its a real space saver.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Yeah, I know, I do that cause it makes me look taller.

lines.speaker: janice
lines.text: Okay, Chandler, come on!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Okay.  Joey, trade lives with me!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Nope.  Man look at this! Ross, I cant believe you said youd play rugby. I mean look how brutal this is!

lines.text: Hey, I can handle it! All right?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Please, Ross, you-you got hurt playing badminton with my dad.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Thats cause-cause youre moms dog kept-kept looking at me.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Okay, Ross, look-look-look-look, look right here. Thats called a scrum, okay? Its kinda like a huddle.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: And is a hum, kinda like a scruddle?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Ross!  Theyre gonna kill you!

lines.speaker: phoebe

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Well, you shouldve seen the guy that she used to go out with. I mean, hes like Joe Rugby.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Youre kidding! And he plays rugby?! Thats so funny.  Ohh! I see how you did that. All right.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Anyway, she thought the very idea of me playing rugby with him was like hilarious. So Im gonna show her how tough I really am!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Im sorry. Im sorry. Youre right, you are a tough guy. Youre the toughest palaeontologist I know.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: All right, come on look, Ross can take care of himself! Its not like hes Chandler!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Thanks!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Look, dont worry about me. Okay? Ill just stay real energetic and stay away from the ball. Ill uh, Ill be that guy right out of the circle.

lines.speaker: all
lines.text: Oh!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh, well maybe there was a dog lookin at him.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Ross-Ross-Ross-Ross! Stay away from that guy , and that guy . And that oneDude! Theyre all huge!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: They dont look any bigger than me!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Well, maybe thats because youre closer to you. So you look bigger to you from where you are.

lines.speaker: emily
lines.text: Im just going to say hi to the lads. All right?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: All right.

lines.speaker: emily
lines.text: Okay.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Hi.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Whoa!  I kinda liked it.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Okay, I know what I have to do. Ive got to go Red Ross.  Yknow, Red Ross!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: I totally dont know what youre talking about.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Come on! The time we were all waiting in line for Dances With Wolves and that one guy cut in line in front of us and I just lost it?! Screamed at him! Turned all red! Red Ross!!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: No.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Youll see.

lines.speaker: emily
lines.text: Liam, do me a favour. Tell the lads to go easy on Ross, its his first time.

lines.speaker: liam
lines.text: You dont say!

lines.speaker: emily
lines.text: Good luck, babe.

lines.speaker: liam
lines.text: Ross! Ross! Come on! Get in here!  Ross! Come on!

lines.speaker: liam
lines.text: Ross, come on! Get in the bloody scrum! Ross, get in!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: JOEY!!!!!!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: You are not going to believe it! Joshua came into work today, and guess what happened?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: He asked you out?!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: No. But I was showing him some cufflinks and I felt his pulse.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Saucy!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: What are these?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Electrical plans for the building.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Okay, okay, okay should I be scared?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: I know that switch does something, okay? So-so I went down to city hall and got these. All I had to do was pay $25 and wait in line for three hours.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Wow! If only more people knew.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Yknow you, really didnt have to take me to the airport.

lines.speaker: janice
lines.text: Oh please. Every moment is precious. Yknow? Besides, somebody had to ride in that other taxi with the rest of your luggage, and your friends dont really seem to care too much that youre leaving.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Well, were really not that close.  Okay, so I guess this is uh, good-bye then.

lines.speaker: janice
lines.text: On no! No! Its not good-bye, Im not leaving until you get on that plane.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Okay. Then I guess its just, wait here then.   Hi. I need one fake ticket to Yemen.

lines.speaker: ticket counter attendant
lines.text: One ticket to Yemen?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Oh no-no-no, no. No, no, no, I just, I just need a pretend ticket.

lines.speaker: ticket counter attendant
lines.text: Im sorry sir, I dont understand.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: What would you give to a kid if he wanted a ticket to play with?

lines.speaker: ticket counter attendant
lines.text: Are you travelling with a child?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: No. All right, yknow what, shes  gonna think that Im handing you a credit card, but what Im really gonna do is hand you a library card.

lines.speaker: ticket counter attendant
lines.text: Ah, sir a ticket to Yemen is $2,100 and we dont take library cards.

lines.speaker: janice
lines.text: Whats the matter? Is something wrong? Do you have to stay?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: American Express?

lines.speaker: emily
lines.text: I cant believe theyre doing that to him! I told them to go easy on him!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: No offence but, yknow sometimes its hard to understand you, yknow with the accent, so

lines.speaker: emily
lines.text: Thats just halftime, theres more of this.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Did you see me? I was pretty good, huh? That is one fun game!

lines.speaker: emily
lines.text: Right.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Hey, could you do me a favour? Could you just grab me a bottle of water?

lines.speaker: emily
lines.text: Okay.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Thanks.  I-I think Im dying. I really do.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oh, poor baby.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Tell my son that I love him.  Excellent! Well, okay, I gotta have some more fun!

lines.speaker: emily
lines.text: Ross, they are killing you out there!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Thats not true!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Shes right! You have to stop!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: What? No! No, Im not stopping. Im Red Ross!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Dude, if you go back out there, youre gonna be Dead Ross!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: I dont care! I am not quitting! I insist on finishing this game!

lines.speaker: emily
lines.text: All right, all right, if you insist on doing this, at least let me help you.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: No, God no! That is no place for a woman. Those guys will grab anything.

lines.speaker: emily
lines.text: No. Thats not what Im saying. I just may know a few things that might help you inflict some pain.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: I like that.

lines.speaker: emily
lines.text: Yeah? Listen closely, Devon has got a weak ankle.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Huh?

lines.speaker: emily
lines.text: One swift kick and hell back off.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: All right, bad ankle, got it!

lines.speaker: emily
lines.text: And that big bloke with the beard, he has got a trick hip. Yeah. And uh, and David over there, I heard he doesnt wear a cup.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Yeah? I can use that, trick hip, no cup, okay! Okay!

lines.speaker: emily
lines.text: And uh, Liam, Liams got bad knees. You hit him right and hell go down like a lamp.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: But-but, Liams on my team.

lines.speaker: emily
lines.text: I dont care! You just get him!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Im gonna go get him! Okay, I am going back in!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: The Red Ross! Okay.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Hey!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Hi!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: What-what are-what are these?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Oh, just some pictures I made and hung up. I thought theyd brighten up the place. They do dont you think?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: No-no-no, no!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: I know that theres no hole there, I just really liked that picture.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh my God! Look at this!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Okay, but there is a wire back there! I mean that switch is connected to something!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: I dont care! The wires have come loose in your head!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: I just thought that if I could follow the wire I could find out what it did.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: And did you?!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: No. It disappears back there behind that baseboard. For a minute there, I thought it went downstairs.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: But it didnt. Say hello to Mrs. Chatracus.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh my God.

lines.speaker: mrs. chatracus
lines.text: Hello darling.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Hello, Mrs. Chatracus.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Now, are you sure you dont want to go see a doctor?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Oh no! That-thatll just bring me down! This was great! I mean I-I-I was great! This is a great day! Yknow what? Im buying everyone coffee. All right? If someone would just grab my wallet, its in my pocket.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Yeah, sure.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: No, not you.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Uhh, look, your eyes still popping out a little, Im gonna go get some ice.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Ooh, ice! I am so in the mood for ice!

lines.speaker: emily
lines.text: You were amazing out there.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Oh, I kinda was, wasnt I?

lines.speaker: emily
lines.text: Oh my God!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: I made a man twice my size cry. I mean, I havent done that since I was four and I washed my dads Porsche with rocks.

lines.speaker: emily
lines.text: You really enjoyed yourself didnt you?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Please! Are you kidding? I-I hurt three huge men, I gave a guy a bloody noseI mean I-Im not proud of it but, I really am. And its all because of you, wonderful, amazing you.

lines.speaker: emily
lines.text: I think youve got concussion.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: No, no, Im serious. Thank you.

lines.speaker: emily
lines.text: Youre welcome.  Im sorry. Did I hurt you?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Its worth the pain.  Yknow what, you know what? Its not.

lines.speaker: ticket counter attendant
lines.text: This is the final boarding call for Flight 664 to Yemen.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Well, I-I guess I gotta go.

lines.speaker: janice
lines.text: Oh, my Bing-a-ling. Ill wait for you. Do you even know how long youre going to be gone?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Well, just until we find an energy source to replace fuel.

lines.speaker: janice
lines.text: Oh. Well, Ill right you everyday.  15 Yemen Road, Yemen.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Okay, good-bye. Good-bye.

lines.speaker: janice
lines.text: Chandler?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: No!

lines.speaker: janice
lines.text: Chandler!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Janice! There you are! There you are! I had to have one last kiss, and also-also you said that you were going to leave right after I got on the plane!

lines.speaker: janice
lines.text: No! No! I wanna see you take-off.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Well, I then guess Im going to Yemen! Im going to Yemen!  When we get to Yemen, can I stay with you?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: All right. The super couldnt figure out what it did. A $200 an hour electrician couldnt figure out what it did. Ive had seven pretty serious shocks. I officially give up.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Thank God.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: I guess Joey was right, it does nothing.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: See? Im doing it. I am totally doing it.  I lost it.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: What is it hon?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: I-I cant find anything that I want to eat! Everything I eat makes me nauseous! Im telling you, being pregnant is no piece of cakeooh! Cake!  No.

I mean, hey, yknow, I like Ross as much as the next guy, yknow? Clearly I have feelings for him, but feelings dont mean love! I mean, I still have loving feelings for Ross. Yeah! But, I have, I have continuing feelings of love, but that doesnt mean that-that Im still in love with him. Yknow? I-I have sexual feelings for him, but I do love himOhh! Oh my God! Oh mywhy didnt you tell me?!!
